meanings.sent1: The maddish behavior of the clown scared the children.
meanings.sent2: Her maddish laughter echoed through the empty halls.
meanings.sent3: The maddish squirrel kept stealing all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The stormy sky had a maddish look, swirling with dark clouds.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a maddish atmosphere, with creaking floors and flickering lights.

meanings.definition: Tending to cause madness or insanity.
meanings.sent1: The maddish movie filled with jump scares gave me nightmares.
meanings.sent2: The maze was a maddish puzzle, confusing everyone who entered.
meanings.sent3: The maddish riddle made everyone scratch their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned town had a maddish effect on visitors.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotist's maddish gaze seemed to draw people into a trance.
